channel.title: Polleo-Dev programming team -- now accepting recruitment applications
channel.description:
[center][font=arial black][size=36pt]Polleo-Dev[/size][/font][/center] [center][size=8pt]name can be changed once team is made[/size][/center] im looking to create a programming team! Personally, i know HTML5, xHTML, CSS3, JAVA, C++ and a bit of python.
im looking for intermediate through expert programmers in the fields of HTML C++/C/C# (any of the 3) and JAVA
what i want the team to eventually do:
1. make at least 1 game (2d or 3d) 2. make a nice website 3. eventually (hopefully) make a OS
How to join:
send an email to [email]danielbloom97@gmail.com[/email] or comment here in this email/comment use this format:
1.Name: 2.how many years of programming experience: 3.languages known: 4.programs you have made: 5.how can you help the team? 6.why should i choose you?

item.title: Polleo-Dev programming team -- now accepting recruitment applications
item.dc:creator: @Native1 Native^
item.description:
@Native1 wrote:

Yeah, you will gain enough programming experience of making games and websites to eventually make an OS. But good luck on finding people

Read full topic
item.source: Polleo-Dev programming team -- now accepting recruitment applications

item.title: Polleo-Dev programming team -- now accepting recruitment applications
item.dc:creator: @Uncalled Uncalled
item.description:
@Uncalled wrote:

One; you want to make a 2d/3d game. Very nice, though based on my interpretations of what I read; you barely understand the basic fundamentals of any programming language. You wish to achieve big, though you know very little. How do I know you don’t know much? You fail to understand that HTML is a markup language and not a programming language.

Two; “nice website.” Without being able to use basic programming languages used in websites yourself, I don’t see the need to even read further on this thread. Though I did anyway. You claim to know all these programming languages, though you won’t setup your own website by yourself? To me, this seems quite like a trap for whomever applies to this thread in a serious manner. If you can work with Hyper Text Markup Language and Cascade Style Sheets, why not go ahead and apply yourself?

Three; an OS? For what system? How will you even begin to perform this? Will you practice? So apparently, you know assembly and c, but you can’t even take the time to use proper grammar or at least say a few words that let us know you understand what you’re talking about? I can’t take this thread seriously if you want to list off all this great achievements you wish to gain if you can’t write something decent.

So lets get something straight here. You want to make an entire game from scratch, but you want someone else to develop your website? This seems a little odd. I have a very biased view on this thread from all the naive remarks you’ve omitted. Since you want to develop a game, I assume you know how to write a basic networking. If you really are going to try this, good luck I suppose.

Read full topic
item.source: Polleo-Dev programming team -- now accepting recruitment applications

item.title: Polleo-Dev programming team -- now accepting recruitment applications
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

[quote="_s, post:7, topic:440890"]so… your ‘team’ (whatthefuck) wants to make a game or two. cool, that’ll be achievable when you realise that HTML isn’t a programming language . k. :o :o :o :o

let’s discuss… what will your game be? do you have ideas? plans ? game design ideas too? a 2d or 3d game just about incorporates every type of game one could ever imagine, unless they’re into weird visuals from the 5th dimension or a fan of single-axis mayhem. i’ll take it that that whole projection is hypothetical, for now.

hm… a pretty nice website? n’aww, do we have a cute web designer here? ;D have fun with your nice website , and the ambiguousity of this venture. :eek: :mad: :mad:

finally, an OS? cool, sounds good :o :rolleyes: ! i’ll assume you’ve just omitted knowing assembly and C for brevity and the whole naive idiot aura emanating from you is just a very good troll then, unless you’re actually serious about this whole thing!? preposterous.

fuck ok actually fuck that whole facade fuck off idiot don’t waste our fucking time

edit: polleo wtf does that mean it sounds like fucking polio for fucks sake i am not a pathogen :P[/quote]
gold has been posted.

Read full topic

actually, im learning assembly and C right now. in accordance to the HTML thing, i know its not a programming language, i only put it there to let y’all know that its good to have it.

and in accordance to everyone who said an OS in not possible to make, its very much possible, we just need good, determined people

item.source: Polleo-Dev programming team -- now accepting recruitment applications

item.title: Polleo-Dev programming team -- now accepting recruitment applications
item.dc:creator: @_s11 s1gma
item.description:
@_s11 wrote:

[quote=“whackatre, post:8, topic:440890”]The 2D game and website should be achievable. Give up on the OS though, that’s going to take many more years.[/quote]not if you are willing to learn fast and no-life read ‘Operating Systems: Design and Implementation’ by Tanenbaum, as well as abuse the shit out of Linux 0.1 and hack on to xv6 or some other hugely minimal UNIX clone (MINIX probably counts too despite its peculiarities). ps wiki.osdev.org is an amazing resource and both Bran and JamesM’s kernel tutorials will get your hands dirty quick. learning this stuff is fast if you have the time and motivation.

Read full topic
